org.apache.flink.runtime.state.filesystem

类 FsStateBackend

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.runtime.state.AbstractStateBackend
      • org.apache.flink.runtime.state.filesystem.FsStateBackend
  • 所有已实现的接口:
    java.io.Serializable, StateBackend

    public class FsStateBackend
extends AbstractStateBackend
    The file state backend is a state backend that stores the state of streaming jobs in a file system.

    The state backend has one core directory into which it puts all checkpoint data. Inside that directory, it creates a directory per job, inside which each checkpoint gets a directory, with files for each state, for example: hdfs://namenode:port/flink-checkpoints/<job-id>/chk-17/6ba7b810-9dad-11d1-80b4-00c04fd430c8

    另请参阅:
    序列化表格

    • 字段概要

      字段 
      限定符和类型 字段和说明
      private boolean asynchronousSnapshots
      Switch to chose between synchronous and asynchronous snapshots
      private Path basePath
      The path to the directory for the checkpoint data, including the file system description via scheme and optional authority
      static int DEFAULT_FILE_STATE_THRESHOLD
      By default, state smaller than 1024 bytes will not be written to files, but will be stored directly with the metadata
      private int fileStateThreshold
      State below this size will be stored as part of the metadata, rather than in files
      private static int MAX_FILE_STATE_THRESHOLD
      Maximum size of state that is stored with the metadata, rather than in files
      private static long serialVersionUID

        FS_STATE_BACKEND_NAME, MEMORY_STATE_BACKEND_NAME, ROCKSDB_STATE_BACKEND_NAME

    • 构造器详细资料

      • FsStateBackend

        public FsStateBackend(java.lang.String checkpointDataUri)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new state backend that stores its checkpoint data in the file system and location defined by the given URI.

        A file system for the file system scheme in the URI (e.g., 'file://', 'hdfs://', or 'S3://') must be accessible via FileSystem.get(URI).

        For a state backend targeting HDFS, this means that the URI must either specify the authority (host and port), or that the Hadoop configuration that describes that information must be in the classpath.

        参数:
        checkpointDataUri - The URI describing the filesystem (scheme and optionally authority), and the path to the checkpoint data directory.
        抛出:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if no file system can be found for the scheme in the URI.

      • FsStateBackend

               throws java.io.IOException

        For a state backend targeting HDFS, this means that the URI must either specify the authority (host and port), or that the Hadoop configuration that describes that information must be in the classpath.

        参数:

        asynchronousSnapshots - Switch to enable asynchronous snapshots.
        抛出:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if no file system can be found for the scheme in the URI.

      • FsStateBackend

        public FsStateBackend(java.net.URI checkpointDataUri,
                      int fileStateSizeThreshold)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new state backend that stores its checkpoint data in the file system and location defined by the given URI.

        A file system for the file system scheme in the URI (e.g., 'file://', 'hdfs://', or 'S3://') must be accessible via FileSystem.get(URI).

        For a state backend targeting HDFS, this means that the URI must either specify the authority (host and port), or that the Hadoop configuration that describes that information must be in the classpath.

        参数:
        checkpointDataUri - The URI describing the filesystem (scheme and optionally authority), and the path to the checkpoint data directory.
        fileStateSizeThreshold - State up to this size will be stored as part of the metadata, rather than in files
        抛出:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if no file system can be found for the scheme in the URI.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown, if the fileStateSizeThreshold is out of bounds.

      • FsStateBackend

        public FsStateBackend(java.net.URI checkpointDataUri,
                      int fileStateSizeThreshold,
                      boolean asynchronousSnapshots)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new state backend that stores its checkpoint data in the file system and location defined by the given URI.

        A file system for the file system scheme in the URI (e.g., 'file://', 'hdfs://', or 'S3://') must be accessible via FileSystem.get(URI).

        For a state backend targeting HDFS, this means that the URI must either specify the authority (host and port), or that the Hadoop configuration that describes that information must be in the classpath.

        参数:
        checkpointDataUri - The URI describing the filesystem (scheme and optionally authority), and the path to the checkpoint data directory.
        fileStateSizeThreshold - State up to this size will be stored as part of the metadata, rather than in files
        asynchronousSnapshots - Switch to enable asynchronous snapshots.
        抛出:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if no file system can be found for the scheme in the URI.

    • 方法详细资料

      • getBasePath

        public Path getBasePath()
        Gets the base directory where all state-containing files are stored. The job specific directory is created inside this directory.
        返回:
        The base directory.

      • getMinFileSizeThreshold

        public int getMinFileSizeThreshold()
        Gets the threshold below which state is stored as part of the metadata, rather than in files. This threshold ensures that the backend does not create a large amount of very small files, where potentially the file pointers are larger than the state itself.

        By default, this threshold is 1024.

        返回:
        The file size threshold, in bytes.

                                                   java.lang.String operatorIdentifier)
                                            throws java.io.IOException

        Creates a CheckpointStreamFactory that can be used to create streams that should end up in a checkpoint.

        jobId - The JobID of the job for which we are creating checkpoint streams.

        java.io.IOException

      • createSavepointStreamFactory

        public CheckpointStreamFactory createSavepointStreamFactory(JobID jobId,
                                                            java.lang.String operatorIdentifier,
                                                            java.lang.String targetLocation)
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        从接口复制的说明: StateBackend
        Creates a CheckpointStreamFactory that can be used to create streams that should end up in a savepoint.

        This is only called if the triggered checkpoint is a savepoint. Commonly this will return the same factory as for regular checkpoints, but maybe slightly adjusted.

        指定者:
        createSavepointStreamFactory 在接口中 StateBackend
        指定者:
        createSavepointStreamFactory 在类中 AbstractStateBackend
        参数:
        jobId - The JobID of the job for which we are creating checkpoint streams.
        operatorIdentifier - An identifier of the operator for which we create streams.
        targetLocation - An optional custom location for the savepoint stream.
        返回:
        The stream factory for savepoints.
        抛出:
        java.io.IOException - Failures during stream creation are forwarded.

      • createKeyedStateBackend

        public <K> AbstractKeyedStateBackend<K> createKeyedStateBackend(Environment env,
                                                                JobID jobID,
                                                                java.lang.String operatorIdentifier,
                                                                TypeSerializer<K> keySerializer,
                                                                int numberOfKeyGroups,
                                                                KeyGroupRange keyGroupRange,
                                                                TaskKvStateRegistry kvStateRegistry)
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
        从接口复制的说明: StateBackend
        Creates a new AbstractKeyedStateBackend that is responsible for holding keyed state and checkpointing it.

        Keyed State is state where each value is bound to a key.

        指定者:
        createKeyedStateBackend 在接口中 StateBackend
        指定者:
        createKeyedStateBackend 在类中 AbstractStateBackend
        类型参数:
        K - The type of the keys by which the state is organized.
        返回:
        The Keyed State Backend for the given job, operator, and key group range.
        抛出:
        java.io.IOException

      • createOperatorStateBackend

        public OperatorStateBackend createOperatorStateBackend(Environment env,
                                                       java.lang.String operatorIdentifier)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        从接口复制的说明: StateBackend
        Creates a new OperatorStateBackend that can be used for storing operator state.

        Operator state is state that is associated with parallel operator (or function) instances, rather than with keys.

        指定者:
        createOperatorStateBackend 在接口中 StateBackend
        指定者:
        createOperatorStateBackend 在类中 AbstractStateBackend
        参数:
        env - The runtime environment of the executing task.
        operatorIdentifier - The identifier of the operator whose state should be stored.
        返回:
        The OperatorStateBackend for operator identified by the job and operator identifier.
        抛出:
        java.lang.Exception - This method may forward all exceptions that occur while instantiating the backend.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        覆盖:
        toString 在类中 java.lang.Object

      • validateAndNormalizeUri

        private static Path validateAndNormalizeUri(java.net.URI checkpointDataUri)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Checks and normalizes the checkpoint data URI. This method first checks the validity of the URI (scheme, path, availability of a matching file system) and then normalizes the URI to a path.

        If the URI does not include an authority, but the file system configured for the URI has an authority, then the normalized path will include this authority.

        参数:
        checkpointDataUri - The URI to check and normalize.
        返回:
        A normalized URI as a Path.
        抛出:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown, if the URI misses scheme or path.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if no file system can be found for the URI's scheme.
